verse:
भयादस्याग्निस्तपति भयात्तपति सूर्यः।
भयादिन्द्रश्च वायुश्च मृत्युर्धावति पञ्चमः ॥

terms.पञ्चमः: Fifth (refers to Lord Yama, the Lord of Death)

meaning: Meaning:Due to fear, fire burns; due to fear, the sun burns; due to fear, Indra and the wind run; due to fear, Death (Yama) runs.The verse emphasizes that all living beings, including gods and elemental forces, are driven by fear. Even powerful entities like fire, the sun, Indra (the king of gods), the wind, and death run out of fear. This highlights the inexorable and universal nature of fear, which affects all living beings, irrespective of their power or status.

upanishad-org.meaning: For fear of Him the fire burneth, for fear of Him the sun giveth heat, for fear of Him Indra and Vayu and Death hasten in their courses.
